oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Signal station on Vung Chua Mountain at dusk

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The signal station of the 1st Signal Brigade on Vung Chua Mountain at dusk.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military facilities;
United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th; United States. Army. Signal Brigade, 1st; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; Vietnam; Qui Nhon (Vietnam)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The 1st Signal Brigade was activated on April 1, 1966, in order to place tactical and strategic communications in Southeast Asia under a single, unified command. Its mission was to install, operate, and maintain a complex communications system for forces spread out over 60,000 square miles.
